IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ROCKEFELLER FAMILY FUND IS A U.S. BASED, FAMILY-LED PUBLIC CHARITY THAT INITIATES, CULTIVATES, AND FUNDS STRATEGIC EFFORTS TO PROMOTE A SUSTAINABLE, JUST, FREE, AND PARTICIPATORY SOCIETY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ROCKEFELLER FAMILY FUND IS A U.S. BASED, FAMILY-LED PUBLIC CHARITY THAT INITIATES, CULTIVATES, AND FUNDS STRATEGIC EFFORTS TO PROMOTE A SUSTAINABLE, JUST, FREE, AND PARTICIPATORY SOCIETY.
IRS990.Desc: PROJECT FUNDS - RFF MANAGES A NUMBER OF PROJECT FUNDS IN THE AREAS OF WORK/LIFE INITIATIVES; REDUCING THE GLOBAL USE OF FOSSIL FUELS AND ADVANCING POLICIES TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE AND THE TRANSITION TO A CLEAN TECH ECONOMY; AND U.S. DEMOCRACY AND NONPARTISAN VOTER ENGAGEMENT. IN EACH OF THESE AREAS, RFF DEVELOPS AND MANAGES INITIATIVES IN CONJUNCTION WITH FUNDER PARTNERS, INDIVIDUALS, AND EXISTING NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, TO ADVANCE CRITICAL POLICY OBJECTIVES OR BUILD NECESSARY CAPACITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: DONOR ADVISED FUNDS - RFF ADVANCES ITS MISSION INCLUDING ENVIRONMENT PROTECTION AND COMBATTING CLIMATE CHANGE, DEMOCRACY AND ECONOMIC JUSTICE THROUGH ITS DONOR-ADVISED FUNDS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CORE FUNDS - THE ROCKEFELLER FAMILY FUND CORE PROGRAM SERVICES REPRESENT AREAS SUCH AS ENVIRONMENT ("ENV"),EMERGING OPPORTUNITIES ("EO"), ECONOMIC JUSTICE FOR WOMEN ("EJW"), AND DEMOCRACY ("DEM").SEE SCHEDULE O FOR AN EXPLANATION OF ENV, EO, EJW, AND DEM PROGRAM AREAS.ENVIRONMENT - FUNDS CLIMATE CHANGE INITIATIVES DESIGNED TO ENACT POLICIES AT THE STATE AND NATIONAL LEVELS TO REDUCE CARBON EMISSIONS; ACCELERATE THE TRANSITION TO A CLEAN-ENERGY ECONOMY; BRING DIVERSE AND COMPELLING NEW VOICES INTO THE CLIMATE DEBATE; AND EXAMINE HOW SPECIAL INTERESTS AND OFFICIALS ARE DISTORTING SCIENCE AND DELAYING CONSTRUCTIVE STEPS TO DEAL WITH THIS IMPENDING GLOBAL CRISIS. ECONOMIC JUSTICE FOR WOMEN - SUPPORT PROJECTS DESIGNED TO PROMOTE WOMEN'S ECONOMIC EQUALITY AND EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT. CURRENTLY, THE PROGRAM SEEKS TO ADVANCE WORKPLACE REFORM POLICIES SUCH AS A PAID SICK LEAVE, FLEX TIME, AND RAISING THE MINIMUM WAGE. DEMOCRACY - ENCOURAGES THE ACTIVE PARTICIPATION OF CITIZENS IN GOVERNMENT, SEEKS TO MAKE GOVERNMENT AND PRIVATE INSTITUTIONS MORE ACCOUNTABLE AND RESPONSIVE, AND SUPPORTS EFFORTS TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS' RIGHTS AND LIBERTIES UNDER THE CONSTITUTION ARE PROTECTED.EMERGING OPPORTUNITIES - ENCOURAGES CREATIVE PUBLIC EDUCATION AND ADVOCACY IN ISSUE AREAS OUTSIDE OF RFF'S CURRENT AREAS OF FOCUS, BUT STILL WITHIN RFF'S ESTABLISHED PROGRAM AREAS AND SUPPLEMENTS THE RESPECTIVE ANNUAL BUDGET ALLOCATIONS FOR RFF'S OTHER PROGRAM AREA IN ORDER TO SEIZE EMERGING OPPORTUNITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION INTENDS TO USE ITS ENDOWMENT FUNDS TO PROVIDE FUNDING AND SUPPORT FOR ITS PROGRAMS IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE DONOR RESTRICTIONS.

THE FUND FOLLOWS THE PROVISIONS OF ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION (ASC) SUBTOPIC 740-10, ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES, WHICH ADDRESSES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTIES IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PRESCRIBES A THRESHOLD FOR THE RECOGNITION AND DERECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. ASC SUBTOPIC 740-10 ALSO PROVIDES RELATED GUIDANCE ON MEASUREMENT, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, AND DISCLOSURES. THE FUND HAS CONCLUDED THAT THERE WERE NO UNCERTAINTIES TO DISCLOSE. THE FUND IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR PERIODS PRIOR TO DECEMBER 31, 2018.
REVENUE FROM RELATED PARTY 10,014,467.
ELIMINATING ENTRY - RELATED PARTY 10,503,697. PASS-THROUGH UNRELATED BUSINESS LOSS FROM ALTERNATIVE 27,498.
EXPENSES FROM RELATED PARTY 12,657,315.
ELIMINATING ENTRY - RELATED PARTY 10,393,697. REFUND OF GRANTS 60,447.
INVESTMENTS IN THE REGION OF CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN CONSIST OF A DIRECT INVESTMENT IN A HEDGE FUND AS WELL AS INVESTMENTS HELD IN PRIVATE EQUITY FUND OF FUNDS.
THE ORGANIZATION IS REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 926 BECAUSE IT DOES MEET THE APPLICABLE OWNERSHIP THRESHOLD OR OTHER FILING REQUIREMENTS.
THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 5471 BECAUSE IT DOES NOT MEET THE APPLICABLE OWNERSHIP THRESHOLD OR OTHER FILING REQUIREMENTS.
THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 8621 BECAUSE IT DOES NOT MEET THE APPLICABLE OWNERSHIP THRESHOLD OR OTHER FILING REQUIREMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BEFORE GRANT FUNDING IS PROVIDED TO AN ORGANIZATION, THE ROCKEFELLER FAMILY FUND (THE FUND) REQUESTS AND REVIEWS ORGANIZATIONAL INFORMATION FROM PROSPECTIVE GRANTEES, INCLUDING AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, TAX RETURN INFORMATION, AND, IF APPLICABLE, FUNDING PROPOSALS. THE FUND ALSO PERFORMS A DUE DILIGENCE CHECK, TO CONFIRM THAT THE ORGANIZATION IS IN GOOD STANDING AND A RECOGNIZED PUBLIC CHARITY OR OTHER TYPE OF PERMISSIBLE GRANTEE. GRANT FUNDS ARE PROVIDED AFTER A GRANT AGREEMENT IS EXECUTED BY BOTH PARTIES SETTING OUT THE PERMISSIBLE AND PROHIBITED USES OF FUNDS. THE FUND MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN A VARIETY OF WAYS: THE FUND REQUIRES AN ANNUAL NARRATIVE REPORT OF ACTIVITIES FINANCED BY THE GRANT. IF RELEVANT, A FINANCIAL REPORT DETAILING THE EXPENDITURE OF GRANT FUNDS IS REQUIRED. OFTEN LARGER GRANTS ARE DISTRIBUTED IN AT LEAST TWO PAYMENTS, WITH THE LATTER PAYMENT RELEASED ONLY AFTER REVIEW OF THE GRANTEE'S WORK DURING THE PREVIOUS PERIOD. FOR SIGNIFICANT GRANTS, THE FUND REGULARLY SPEAKS WITH THE GRANTEE THROUGHOUT THE GRANT PERIOD TO ASSESS THE GRANTEE'S PERFORMANCE AND DISCUSS CORRECTIVE ACTION, IF NECESSARY.

HOUSING ALLOWANCE IS BASED ON A FIXED AMOUNT DETERMINED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE 2021 HOUSING ALLOWANCE IN THE AMOUNT OF $31,800 PAID TO LEE WASSERMAN, DIRECTOR & SECRETARY, IS INCLUDED IN THE REPORTABLE COMPENSATION, PART II, COLUMN B (III).

IN MARCH 2020, THE FUND ENTERED INTO A NEW SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN FOR LEE H. WASSERMAN. AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2021, A LIABILITY OF $761,565 IS INCLUDED IN PENSION COSTS REPRESENTING THE VALUE OF THE FUND'S CURRENT OBLIGATION TO THE SERP.
INDIVIDUAL REPORTED ON SCHEDULE J, PART II RECEIVED DISCRETIONARY BONUS IN 2021. THE AMOUNT IS REPORTED ON SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN B(III).

THE TREASURER IS PAID BY AN UNRELATED ORGANIZATION, ROCKEFELLER BROTHERS FUND (RBF), EIN 13-1760106, FOR SERVICES RENDERED TO THE FILING ORGANIZATION. TWENTY-FIVE HOURS PER WEEK ARE DEVOTED AND ITS ALLOCABLE SHARE OF COMPENSATION, PENSION, AND BENEFITS ARE REPORTED ON PART VII.
THE ORGANIZATION IS REPORTING THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LUCIA GILL CASE AND PETER GILL CASE HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP. MICHAEL LAMBERT AND REBECCA LAMBERT HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP. ELIZA ROCKEFELLER AND TARA ROCKEFELLER HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP. MIRANDA KAISER AND NEVA GOODWIN HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 AND SUPPORTING SCHEDULES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND THEN DISTRIBUTED VIA EMAIL, IN PDF FORMAT, TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW BEFORE FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH DIRECTOR, PRINCIPAL OFFICER AND MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH GOVERNING BOARD DELEGATED POWERS, AND KEY PERSON MUST ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT WHICH AFFIRMS SUCH PERSON HAS: (A) RECEIVED A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, (B) READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY, (C) AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY, (D)SUBMITTED A STATEMENT TO THE SECRETARY IDENTIFYING TO THE BEST OF SUCH INDIVIDUAL'S KNOWLEDGE (I) ANY ENTITY OF WHICH SUCH INDIVIDUAL IS AN OFFICER, DIRECTOR, TRUSTEE, MEMBER, OWNER, OR EMPLOYEE AND WITH WHICH THE ORGANIZATION HAS A RELATIONSHIP, AND (II) ANY TRANSACTION IN WHICH THE ORGANIZATION IS A PARTICIPANT AND IN WHICH THE INDIVIDUAL MIGHT HAVE A CONFLICTING INTEREST, AND (III) ANY RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS, AND(E) UNDERSTANDS THE FUND IS CHARITABLE AND IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS FEDERAL TAX EXEMPTION, IT MUST ENGAGE PRIMARILY IN ACTIVITIES WHICH ACCOMPLISH ONE OR MORE OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. STEPS IN DETERMINING WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS: AFTER DISCLOSURE OF THE FINANCIAL INTEREST AND ALL MATERIAL FACTS, AND AFTER ANY DISCUSSION WITH THE INTERESTED PERSON, HE OR SHE MUST LEAVE THE GOVERNING BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING WHILE THE DETERMINATION OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS DISCUSSED AND VOTED UPON. THE REMAINING BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEMBERS MUST DECIDE IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. IN NO EVENT CAN AN INTERESTED PERSON INFLUENCE IMPROPERLY THE DELIBERATION OR VOTING ON THE MATTER GIVING RISE TO A CONFLICT OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT. RESTRICTIONS IMPOSED ON PERSONS WITH A CONFLICT: IF THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE HAS REASONABLE CAUSE TO BELIEVE A MEMBER HAS FAILED TO DISCLOSE ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, IT MUST INFORM THE MEMBER OF THE BASIS FOR SUCH BELIEF AND AFFORD THE MEMBER AN OPPORTUNITY TO EXPLAIN THE ALLEGED FAILURE TO DISCLOSE. IF AFTER HEARING THE MEMBER'S RESPONSE AND AFTER MAKING FURTHER INVESTIGATION AS WARRANTED BY THE CIRCUMSTANCES, THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE DETERMINES THE MEMBER HAS FAILED TO DISCLOSE AN ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST, IT SHALL TAKE APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINARY AND CORRECTIVE ACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ROCKEFELLER FAMILY FUND INDEPENDENT EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL COMPENSATION MATTERS. THE COMMITTEE MEETS ANNUALLY TO CONSIDER THE PERFORMANCE OF THE DIRECTOR AND, AT REGULAR INTERVALS, CONSIDER COMPARABLE COMPENSATION DATA FOR CEOS IN CHARGE OF SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS. ON THE BASIS OF THE ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW AND SAID COMPENSATION DATA, THE COMMITTEE ESTABLISHES THE COMPENSATION FOR THE DIRECTOR FOR THE SUCCEEDING YEAR. THE COMMITTEE ALSO REVIEWS THE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATIONS FOR OTHER KEY ORGANIZATIONAL STAFF. THE COMMITTEE MAINTAINS CONTEMPORANEOUS DOCUMENTATION OF ITS PROCEEDINGS, DELIBERATIONS, AND SUPPORTING MATERIAL IN THE MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FUND'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

ANDREA LAWYER DEVOTES APPROXIMATELY 25 HOURS PER WEEK TO ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL REPORTING SERVICES FOR THE ROCKEFELLER FAMILY FUND (RFF). MS. LAWYER IS PAID FOR THESE SERVICES BY THE ROCKEFELLER BROTHERS FUND (RBF) PURSUANT TO A COST-SHARING AGREEMENT BETWEEN RBF AND RFF. RFF REIMBURSES RBF FOR HER SERVICES PURSUANT TO THE AGREEMENT.

THE TIOGA FUND AND THE ROCKEFELLER FAMILY FUND (RFF) HAVE A SHARED SERVICES AGREEMENT, UNDER WHICH TIOGA FUND PAYS RFF FOR TIOGA'S USE OF RFF'S PERSONNEL AND OTHER RESOURCES. RFF EMPLOYS ALL PERSONNEL, WHO THEN PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE TIOGA FUND AS NEEDED. THE TIOGA FUND PROVIDES FUNDS TO RFF TO COVER THE FULL COSTS OF THESE SERVICES. THERE IS NO FINANCIAL OR ECONOMIC CONTROL BETWEEN THE TWO ENTITIES. THE TIOGA FUND'S PRESIDENT IS ALSO THE PRESIDENT OF RFF. THE TIOGA FUND IS TAX-EXEMPT UNDER SECTION 501(C)(4) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. ITS MISSION IS TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT ADVOCACY STRATEGIES TO ADVANCE CLIMATE CHANGE SOLUTIONS, ADDRESS WOMEN'S ECONOMIC INEQUALITY, IMPROVE THE NATION'S DEMOCRATIC INSTITUTIONS, AND PROTECT CITIZENS' CIVIL LIBERTIES. THE TIOGA FUND PAID $61,174 IN 2021 FOR SERVICES UNDER THE AGREEMENT. THERE WERE NO AMOUNTS DUE TO RFF ON DECEMBER 31, 2021.
AMOUNT NOT YET RECOGNIZED AS A COMPONENT OF NET PERIODIC BENEFIT COST 198,437. REFUND OF GRANTS 60,447. PASS-THROUGH UNRELATED BUSINESS LOSS FROM ALTERNATIVE -27,498.
